intro: Diplycosia luzonica var. calelanensis, commonly known as the Luzon diplycosia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid tropical climates. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential ecological role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
